comments:
Build Eclipse 3.0 M6, CDT 2.0.0.0021

If I rename the directory "eclipse" (where eclipse.exe resides), eclipse.exe 
cannot load anymore.  CDT has to be installed.  If CDT is not installed, there 
is no problems.

Steps:
1) Install Eclipse 3.0 M6 
2) Start Eclipse to create the workspace
3) Install CDT
4) Close Eclipse
5) Go to Windows Explorer and rename the "eclipse" directory "eclipseM6" (so 
eclipse.exe will reside now in eclipseM6.
6) restart
Eclipse is frozen at the splash screen.
  The log has thi error:

Afterwards,  if you go back to Windows Explorer and rename the "eclipseM6" back 
to "eclipse", eclipse can not load still.  It looks like the .metadata 
corrupted.

This might be related to bug 50495.

Then don't do that...

Eclipse does not claim to support moving workspaces around. If you really feel 
like chasing this down, send a bug report to the eclipse platform guys.

3 things why I reported this bug for CDT and not for Eclipse:

-The bug does not happen when CDT is not installed.
-might be related to bug 50495 where CDT has disappear.  I wanted to save my 
current eclipse directory framework to show bug 50495.  So, I rename my eclipse 
directory so that I can installed another eclipse directory structure.  When 
renaming it, Eclipse with CDT did not start (above bug).
-When renaming the directory back to the original name, Eclipse with CDT still 
could not be started suggesting that the .metadata file might be corrupted.

> The bug does not happen when CDT is not installed

I do not think it is "CDT" related you probably have
the same behaviour if you install another "external" plugin
For example VE, GEF, UML, Omondo etc ..

The .metada is not maintain by the CDT but by the underlying
platform.  You should redirect this bug to the platform
runtime.  We might be doing something wrong(CDT) but that
would be the best start.

James C. reproduced this bug.   He has sent a bug to the Update Manager guys 
(they are currently working on this).  So I will dup this bug with that one.

Thanks for your feedback.

Duplicate of bug 50628

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 50628 ***
